Angela Day wrote:
> 
> Torque works great while running the app or while running the junit 
> tests from the command line, but within eclipse, running a junit test, I 
> get the error "no DataSourceFactory configured for connection default". 
> It fails on the Torque.getConnection command. I have reviewed all of the 
> junit and torque archives and have followed all of the advice, but there 
> is not a change.

Are you sure your Torque properties file is on the class path when you 
run the tests from within Eclipse? Did you place the properties file in 
one of your source folders? (That's usually the easiest approach, since 
Eclipse copies them over to the build target folder as part of the build.)
